alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 9:46PM MST until March 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain will fall on snow leading to increasing melting and runoff. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Verde River...including Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, high flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will increase to flood stage with a maximum value of 12.3 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 10.3 Tue 9 pm MST 10.8 6.6 4.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 500 PM MST.
